sn46.56:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn46.56:1.3: Then Prince Abhaya went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn46.56:1.5: ‘There is no cause or reason for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:1.6: Not knowing and not seeing have no cause or reason.
sn46.56:1.7: There is no cause or reason for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:1.8: Knowing and seeing have no cause or reason.’
sn46.56:1.9: What does the Buddha say about this?”
sn46.56:1.10: “Prince, there are causes and reasons for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:1.11: Not knowing and not seeing have causes and reasons.
sn46.56:1.12: There are causes and reasons for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:1.13: Knowing and seeing have causes and reasons.”
sn46.56:2.1: “But sir, what is the cause and reason for not knowing and not seeing?
sn46.56:2.2: How do not knowing and not seeing have causes and reasons?”
sn46.56:2.3: “There’s a time when the heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.
sn46.56:2.4: This is a cause and reason for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:2.5: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and reasons.
sn46.56:3.1: Furthermore, there’s a time when the heart is overcome and mired in ill will …
sn46.56:3.4: doubt, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from doubt that has arisen.
sn46.56:3.5: This is a cause and reason for not knowing and not seeing.
sn46.56:3.6: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and reasons.”
sn46.56:4.1: “Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”
sn46.56:4.4: Indeed, Holy One, these are hindrances!
sn46.56:4.5: Overcome by even a single hindrance you wouldn’t truly know or see, let alone all five hindrances.
sn46.56:5.1: But sir, what is the cause and reason for knowing and seeing?
sn46.56:5.2: How do knowing and seeing have causes and reasons?”
sn46.56:5.3: “It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.56:5.4: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sn46.56:5.5: This is a cause and reason for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:5.6: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and reasons.
sn46.56:6.1: Furthermore, a mendicant develops the awakening factor of investigation of principles … energy … rapture … tranquility … immersion …
sn46.56:6.2: equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.56:6.3: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of equanimity.
sn46.56:6.4: This is a cause and reason for knowing and seeing.
sn46.56:6.5: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and reasons.”
sn46.56:7.1: “Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”
sn46.56:7.3: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are awakening factors!
sn46.56:7.4: Indeed, Holy One, these are awakening factors!
sn46.56:7.5: Endowed with even a single awakening factor you would truly know and see, let alone all seven awakening factors.
sn46.56:7.6: When climbing Mount Vulture’s Peak I became fatigued in body and mind. But this has now faded away. And I’ve comprehended the teaching.”
